Marking Items as Read or Unread

Change requests, requirements, tasks, and topics that you have not read display in boldface type if you are:

  • The user responsible for the change request, requirement, or task.

  • A recipient of the topic.

After you have reviewed the item properties, the boldface type is replaced by regular type.

To reread all the items on a certain subject, it is sometimes convenient to mark all of the items as unread, to ensure that you do not miss any. You can also mark an entire requirement, task, or topic tree as read or unread.

Note: The personal options you select also affect when items become marked as read or unread.

To mark specific items as read or unread:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click the Change Request, Requirement, Task, or Topic tab.

  3. Select one or more items from the upper pane. Select the items to be made bold (unread) or not bold (read).

  4. Select Mark as unread or Mark as read from the component or the context menu. The items are marked as specified, and the type style changes accordingly.

To mark an entire tree as read or unread:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click the Requirement, Task, or Topic component tab. Click the Tree Display button to display requirements, tasks, or topics as trees.

  3. Select the root of a tree.

  4. Select Mark thread as unread or Mark thread as read from the component or the context menu. The tree is marked as specified, and the type style changes accordingly.
